00243 
00254 static void nfs_rpc_execute( nfs_request_data_t * preqnfs, 
00255                              nfs_worker_data_t  * pworker_data )
00256 {
00257   unsigned int                 rpcxid = 0 ;
00258   nfs_function_desc_t          funcdesc ;
00259   exportlist_t               * pexport = NULL ;
00260   nfs_arg_t                    arg_nfs ;
00261   nfs_res_t                    res_nfs ;  
00262   short                        exportid ;
00263   LRU_list_t                 * lru_dupreq = NULL ;
00264   struct svc_req             * ptr_req = &preqnfs->req ;
00265   SVCXPRT                    * ptr_svc = preqnfs->xprt ;
00266   nfs_res_t                    previous_res_nfs ;
00267   nfs_stat_type_t              stat_type ;
00268   struct sockaddr_in           hostaddr;
00269   struct sockaddr_in         * phostaddr ;
00270 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00271   struct netbuf              * pnetbuf ;
00272 #endif
00273   int                          rc ;
00274   int                          do_dupreq_cache ;
00275   int                          status ;
00276   unsigned int                 i ;
00277   exportlist_client_entry_t    related_client ;
00278   
00279 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS   
00280   static int nb_iter_memleaks = 0 ;
00281 #endif
00282   
00283   /* daemon is terminating, do not process any new request */
00284   if ( nfs_do_terminate  )
00285       return;
00286   
00287   
00288   /* Get the value from the worker data */
00289   lru_dupreq = pworker_data->duplicate_request ;
00290  
00291 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00292   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Program %d, Version %d, Function %d", 
00293                    ptr_req->rq_prog, ptr_req->rq_vers, ptr_req->rq_proc ) ;
00294 #endif  
00295   /* Initing RPC structure */
00296   memset( &arg_nfs, 0, sizeof( arg_nfs ) ) ;
00297   memset( &res_nfs, 0, sizeof( res_nfs ) ) ;
00298 
00299   /* If we reach this point, there was no dupreq cache hit or no dup req cache was necessary*/
00300   if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00301     {
00302       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00303         {
00304         case NFS_V2:
00305           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC_STATFS )
00306            { 
00307              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00308              return ;
00309            }
00310           funcdesc = nfs2_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00311           break ;
00312           
00313         case NFS_V3:
00314           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC3_COMMIT )
00315            { 
00316              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00317              return ;
00318            }
00319           funcdesc = nfs3_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00320           break ;
00321           
00322         case NFS_V4:
00323           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC4_COMPOUND )
00324            { 
00325              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00326              return ;
00327            }
00328           funcdesc = nfs4_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00329           
00330           /* The export list as a whole is given ti NFSv4 request since NFSv4 is capable of junction traversal */
00331           pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00332           break ;
00333           
00334         default:
00335           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00336           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: NFS Protocol version %d unknown", ptr_req->rq_vers ) ;
00337           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00338           return ;
00339           break ;
00340         }
00341     }
00342   else if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00343     {
00344       if( ptr_req->rq_proc > MOUNTPROC3_EXPORT ) /* functions are almost the same in MOUNTv1 and MOUNTv3 */
00345        { 
00346          svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00347          return ;
00348        }
00349       
00350       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00351         {
00352         case MOUNT_V1:
00353           funcdesc = mnt1_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00354           break ;
00355           
00356         case MOUNT_V3:
00357           funcdesc = mnt3_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00358           break ;
00359           
00360         default:
00361           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00362           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: MOUNT Protocol version %d unknown", ptr_req->rq_vers ) ;
00363           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00364           return ;
00365           break ;
00366           
00367         } /* switch( ptr_req->vers ) */
00368     }
00369   else
00370     {
00371       /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00372       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: protocol %d is not managed", ptr_req->rq_prog ) ;
00373       svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00374       return ;
00375     } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_prog ) */
00376 
00377 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00378 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
00379   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_getargs on socket %u, xprt=%p", ptr_svc->xp_fd, ptr_svc ) ;
00380 #else
00381   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_getargs on socket %u, xprt=%p", ptr_svc->xp_sock, ptr_svc ) ;
00382 #endif
00383 #endif
00384 
00385   if( svc_getargs( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) == FALSE )
00386     {
00387       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_getargs" ) ;
00388       svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00389       return ;
00390     }
00391 
00392   /* Tag myself as currently processing this request */
00393   rpcxid = get_rpc_xid( ptr_req ) ;
00394  
00395   /* Is this request already managed by another thread ? 
00396    * In this case, do not handle the request to avoid thread starvation 
00397    * because this shows that the FSAL may hang in a specific call */
00398   for( i = 0 ; i <  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ; i++ )
00399     {
00400         if( workers_data[i].current_xid == rpcxid )
00401           {
00402              DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "Dupreq #%u was asked for process since another thread manage it, reject for avoiding threads starvation...", rpcxid ) ;
00403 
00404             /* Free the arguments */
00405             if( !SVC_FREEARGS( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) )
00406               {
00407                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad SVC_FREEARGS for %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00408               }
00409              return ;
00410           }
00411     }
00412 
00413   /* Manage this request, so keeps its xid in worker_data specific structure */
00414   pworker_data->current_xid = rpcxid ;
00415 
00416 
00417     /* Getting the xid from the RPC request (this value is used for RPC duplicate request hash */
00418   if( ( do_dupreq_cache = funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & CAN_BE_DUP )  )
00419     {
00420       rpcxid = get_rpc_xid( ptr_req ) ;
00421 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00422       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Request has xid=%u", rpcxid ) ;
00423 #endif
00424       previous_res_nfs= nfs_dupreq_get( rpcxid, &status ) ;
00425       if( status == DUPREQ_SUCCESS )
00426         {
00427           /* Request was known, use the previous reply */
00428 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00429           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00430                            "NFS DISPATCHER: DupReq Cache Hit: using previous reply, rpcxid=%u", 
00431                            rpcxid ) ;
00432 #endif
00433 
00434 
00435 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00436 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
00437           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u (dup req)", ptr_svc->xp_fd ) ;
00438 #else
00439           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u (dup req)", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00440 #endif
00441 #endif
00442           if( svc_sendreply( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_encode_func, (caddr_t)&previous_res_nfs ) == FALSE )
00443             {
00444               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_sendreply" ) ;
00445               svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00446             }
00447 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00448 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
00449           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "After svc_sendreply on socket %u (dup req)", ptr_svc->xp_fd ) ;
00450 #else
00451           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "After svc_sendreply on socket %u (dup req)", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00452 #endif
00453 #endif
00454           return ; /* exit the function */
00455         }
00456     }
00457 
00458 
00459   /* Get the export entry */
00460   if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00461     {
00462       /* The NFSv2 and NFSv3 functions'arguments always begin with the file handle (but not the NULL function)
00463        * this hook is used to get the fhandle with the arguments and so 
00464        * determine the export entry to be used.
00465        * In NFSv4, junction traversal is managed by the protocol itself so the whole
00466        * export list is provided to NFSv4 request. */
00467       
00468       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00469         {
00470         case NFS_V2:
00471           if( ptr_req->rq_proc != NFSPROC_NULL ) 
00472             {
00473               exportid = nfs2_FhandleToExportId( ( fhandle2 *)&arg_nfs ) ;
00474 
00475               if( exportid < 0 ) 
00476                 {
00477                   /* Bad argument */
00478                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00479                 }
00480 
00481               if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( nfs_param.pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
00482                 {
00483                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle */
00484                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00485                 }
00486               
00487 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATH
00488               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Found export entry for dirname=%s as exportid=%d", 
00489                                pexport->dirname, pexport->id ) ;
00490 #endif
00491             }
00492           
00493           break ;
00494           
00495         case NFS_V3:
00496           if( ptr_req->rq_proc != NFSPROC_NULL ) 
00497             {
00498               exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( ( nfs_fh3 *)&arg_nfs ) ;
00499               if( exportid < 0 )
00500                 {
00501                   char dumpfh[1024] ;
00502                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle) */
00503                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ,
00504                                    "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d has badly formed file handle, vers=%d, proc=%d FH=%s",
00505                                    ntohs( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ),
00506                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24,
00507                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16,
00508                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8,
00509                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ),
00510                                    ptr_req->rq_vers,
00511                                    ptr_req->rq_proc,
00512                                    dumpfh ) ;
00513                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00514                   return ;
00515                 }
00516 
00517               if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( nfs_param.pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
00518                 {
00519                   char dumpfh[1024] ;
00520                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle) */
00521                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ, 
00522                                    "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d has badly formed file handle, vers=%d, proc=%d FH=%s",
00523                                    ntohs( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ), 
00524                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24, 
00525                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16, 
00526                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8, 
00527                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ), 
00528                                    ptr_req->rq_vers, 
00529                                    ptr_req->rq_proc,
00530                                    dumpfh  ) ;
00531                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00532                   return ;
00533                 }
00534              
00535 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00536               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Found export entry for dirname=%s as exportid=%d", 
00537                                pexport->dirname, pexport->id ) ;
00538 #endif
00539             }
00540           break ;
00541           
00542         case NFS_V4:
00543           pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00544           break ;
00545         } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_vers ) */
00546     }
00547   else if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00548     {
00549       /* Always use the whole export list for mount protocol */
00550       pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00551     } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_prog ) */
00552 
00553   /* Do not call a MAKES_WRITE function on a read-only export entry */
00554   if( ( funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & MAKES_WRITE ) 
00555       && ( pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_RO || 
00556            pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO ) )
00557     {
00558       if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00559         {
00560           if( ptr_req->rq_vers == NFS_V2 )
00561             {
00562               /* All the nfs_res structure in V2 have the status at the same place (because it is an union) */
00563               res_nfs.res_attr2.status = NFSERR_ROFS;
00564               rc = NFS_REQ_OK ; /* Processing of the request is done */
00565             }
00566           else 
00567             {
00568               /* V3 request */
00569               /* All the nfs_res structure in V2 have the status at the same place, and so does V3 ones */
00570               res_nfs.res_attr2.status = (nfsstat2) NFS3ERR_ROFS; 
00571               rc = NFS_REQ_OK ; /* Processing of the request is done */
00572             }
00573         }
00574       else /* unexpected protocol (mount doesn't make write) */
00575         rc = NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00576     }
00577   else
00578     {
00579       /* This is not a MAKES_WRITE call done on a read-only export entry */
00580 
00581       /* 
00582        * It is now time for checking if export list allows the machine to perform the request 
00583        */
00584 
00585       /* Ask the RPC layer for the adresse of the machine */
00586 #ifdef _USE_TIRPC
00587       /*
00588        * In tirpc svc_getcaller is deprecated and replaced by
00589        * svc_getrpccaller().
00590        * svc_getrpccaller return a struct netbuf (see rpc/types.h) instead
00591        * of a struct sockaddr_in directly.
00592        */
00593       pnetbuf = svc_getrpccaller( ptr_svc ) ;
00594       memcpy( (char *)&pworker_data->hostaddr, (char *)pnetbuf->buf, sizeof( pworker_data->hostaddr ) );
00595 #else
00596       phostaddr = svc_getcaller( ptr_svc ) ;
00597       memcpy( (char *)&pworker_data->hostaddr, (char *)phostaddr, sizeof( pworker_data->hostaddr ) );
00598 #endif
00599      
00600       /* Check if client is using a privileged port, but only for NFS protocol */
00601       if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program && ptr_req->rq_proc != 0 ) 
00602         {
00603           if(  ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PRIVILEGED_PORT ) &&
00604                 ( ntohs( hostaddr.sin_port ) >= IPPORT_RESERVED ) ) 
00605                 {
00606                         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "/!\\ | Port %d is too high for this export entry, rejecting client", hostaddr.sin_port ) ;
00607                         svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK ) ;
00608                         pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00609                         return ;
00610                 }
00611         }
00612 
00613       if( nfs_export_check_access( &pworker_data->hostaddr,
00614                                    ptr_req, 
00615                                    pexport,
00616                                    nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00617                                    nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00618                                    pworker_data->ht_ip_stats,
00619                                    pworker_data->ip_stats_pool,
00620                                    &related_client ) == FALSE )
00621          {
00622           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, 
00623                            "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d is not allowed to access this export entry, vers=%d, proc=%d",
00624                            ntohs( phostaddr->sin_addr.s_addr ), 
00625                            ( ntohl( phostaddr->sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24, 
00626                            ( ntohl( phostaddr->sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16, 
00627                            ( ntohl( phostaddr->sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8, 
00628                            ( ntohl( phostaddr->sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ), 
00629                            ptr_req->rq_vers, 
00630                            ptr_req->rq_proc ) ;
00631           /* svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK ) ;*/
00632           pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00633           return ; 
00634          }
00635       
00636       /* Do the authentication stuff, if needed */
00637       if( funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & NEEDS_CRED )
00638         {
00639           if( nfs_build_fsal_context( ptr_req, &related_client, pexport, &pworker_data->thread_fsal_context ) == FALSE )
00640             {
00641               svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK );
00642               pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00643               return ;
00644             }
00645         }
00646 
00647       /* processing */
00648 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00649       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCHER: Calling service function %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00650 #endif
00651       rc = funcdesc.service_function( &arg_nfs, 
00652                                       pexport, 
00653                                       &pworker_data->thread_fsal_context,
00654                                       &(pworker_data->cache_inode_client),
00655                                       pworker_data->ht,
00656                                       ptr_req, 
00657                                       &res_nfs ) ; /* BUGAZOMEU Un appel crade pour debugger */
00658 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00659       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCHER: Function %s exited with status %d", funcdesc.funcname, rc ) ;
00660 #endif
00661     }
00662   
00663   /* Perform statistics here */
00664   stat_type = ( rc == NFS_REQ_OK ) ? GANESHA_STAT_SUCCESS : GANESHA_STAT_DROP ;
00665 
00666   nfs_stat_update( stat_type, &(pworker_data->stats.stat_req) , ptr_req ) ; 
00667   pworker_data->stats.nb_total_req  += 1 ;
00668 
00669   pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00670 
00671   /* If request is dropped, no return to the client */ 
00672   if( rc == NFS_REQ_DROP )
00673     { 
00674      /* The request was dropped */
00675      DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Drop request rpc_xid=%u, program %u, version %u, function %u", 
00676                       rpcxid, ptr_req->rq_prog, ptr_req->rq_vers, ptr_req->rq_proc  ) ;
00677     }
00678   else
00679     {
00680 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00681 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
00682       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_fd ) ;
00683 #else
00684       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00685 #endif
00686 #endif
00687 
00688       /* encoding the result on xdr output */
00689       if( svc_sendreply( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_encode_func, (caddr_t)&res_nfs ) == FALSE )
00690         {
00691           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_sendreply" ) ;
00692           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00693           return ;
00694         }
00695   
00696 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00697 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
00698       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "After svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_fd ) ;
00699 #else
00700       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "After svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00701 #endif
00702 #endif
00703 
00704       /* store in dupreq cache if needed */
00705       if( do_dupreq_cache )
00706         {
00707           if( nfs_dupreq_add( rpcxid, ptr_req, &res_nfs, lru_dupreq, &pworker_data->dupreq_pool ) != DUPREQ_SUCCESS )
00708             {
00709               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad insertion in dupreq cache" ) ;
00710             }
00711         }
00712      } 
00713   /* Free the allocated resources once the work is done */
00714 
00715   /* Free the arguments */
00716   if( !SVC_FREEARGS( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) )
00717     {
00718       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad SVC_FREEARGS for %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00719     }
00720   
00721   /* Free the reply.
00722    * This should not be done if the request is dupreq cached because this will
00723    * mark the dupreq cached info eligible for being reuse by other requests */
00724   if( !do_dupreq_cache )
00725     {
00726       /* Free only the non dropped requests */
00727       if( rc == NFS_REQ_OK ) 
00728          funcdesc.free_function( &res_nfs ) ;
00729     }
00730 
00731 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00732   if( nb_iter_memleaks > 1000 )
00733     {
00734       nb_iter_memleaks = 0  ;
00735       /* BuddyDumpMem( stdout ) ; */
00736       nfs_debug_debug_label_info() ;
00737 
00738       printf( "Stats de ce thread: total mnt1=%u mnt3=%u nfsv2=%u nfsv3=%u nfsv4=%u\n",
00739               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_mnt1_req,
00740               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_mnt3_req,
00741               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs2_req,
00742               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs3_req,
00743               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs4_req ) ;
00744               
00745     }
00746   else
00747     nb_iter_memleaks += 1 ;
00748 #endif
00749 
00750   return ;
00751 } /* nfs_rpc_execute */
00752 
00753 
00754 
00755 
00769 int nfs_Init_worker_data( nfs_worker_data_t * pdata ) 
00770 {
00771   LRU_status_t status = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00772   pthread_mutexattr_t mutexattr ;
00773   pthread_condattr_t  condattr ;
00774   
00775   if( pthread_mutexattr_init( &mutexattr ) != 0 )
00776     return -1 ;
00777 
00778   if( pthread_condattr_init( &condattr ) != 0 )
00779     return -1 ;
00780 
00781   if( pthread_mutex_init( &(pdata->mutex_req_condvar), &mutexattr ) !=0 )
00782     return -1 ;
00783   
00784   if( pthread_mutex_init( &(pdata->request_pool_mutex), &mutexattr ) !=0 )
00785     return -1 ;
00786   
00787   if( pthread_cond_init( &(pdata->req_condvar), &condattr ) != 0 )
00788     return -1 ;
00789   
00790   if( ( pdata->pending_request = LRU_Init( nfs_param.worker_param.lru_param, &status ) ) == NULL )
00791     {
00792       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_LRU, ERR_LRU_LIST_INIT, status ) ;
00793       return -1 ;
00794     }
00795 
00796   if( ( pdata->duplicate_request = LRU_Init( nfs_param.worker_param.lru_dupreq, &status ) ) == NULL )
00797     {
00798       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_LRU, ERR_LRU_LIST_INIT, status ) ;
00799       return -1 ;
00800     }
00801     
00802   pdata->passcounter = 0 ;  
00803   pdata->is_ready = FALSE ;
00804   pdata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ;
00805 
00806   return 0 ;
00807 } /* nfs_Init_worker_data */
00808 
00809 
00822 void * worker_thread( void * IndexArg )
00823 {
00824   nfs_worker_data_t    * pmydata ;
00825   nfs_request_data_t   * pnfsreq ;
00826   LRU_entry_t          * pentry ;
00827   char                 * cred_area;
00828   struct rpc_msg       * pmsg;
00829   struct svc_req       * preq ;
00830   SVCXPRT              * xprt ;
00831   enum auth_stat         why ;
00832   long                   index  ;
00833   bool_t                 found = FALSE ;
00834   int                    rc    = 0 ;
00835   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00836   unsigned int           gc_allowed = FALSE ;
00837   char                   thr_name[128];
00838   char                   auth_str[AUTH_STR_LEN] ;
00839   bool_t                 no_dispatch = FALSE ;
00840 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00841   struct rpc_gss_cred  * gc;
00842 #endif 
00843 
00844   index = (long)IndexArg ;
00845   pmydata= &(workers_data[index]) ;
00846   
00847   snprintf(thr_name, 128, "worker#%ld", index);
00848   SetNameFunction( thr_name ) ;  
00849   
00850 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00851   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : Starting, nb_entry=%d",
00852                    index, pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry ) ;
00853 #endif
00854   /* Initialisation of the Buddy Malloc */ 
00855 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00856   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : Initialization of memory manager", index ) ;
00857 #endif
00858 
00859 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00860   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( &nfs_param.buddy_param_worker )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
00861     {
00862       /* Failed init */
00863       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Memory manager could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00864       exit( 1 ) ;
00865     }
00866   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Memory manager successfully initialized", index ) ;
00867 #endif
00868 
00869   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: my pthread id is %p", index, (caddr_t)pthread_self() ) ;
00870 
00871   /* Initialisation of credential for current thread */ 
00872   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Initialization of thread's credential", index ) ;
00873   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( FSAL_InitClientContext( &pmydata->thread_fsal_context )) )
00874     {
00875       /* Failed init */
00876       DisplayLog( "NFS  WORKER #%d: Error initing thread's credential", index ) ;
00877       exit( 1 ) ;
00878     }
00879       
00880       
00881   /* Init the Cache inode client for this worker */
00882   if( cache_inode_client_init( &pmydata->cache_inode_client,
00883                                nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_inode_client_param,
00884                                index, 
00885                                pmydata ) )
00886     {
00887       /* Failed init */
00888       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Inode client could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00889       exit( 1 ) ;
00890     }
00891   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Inode client successfully initialized", index ) ;
00892  
00893 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00894   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( MFSL_GetContext(  &pmydata->cache_inode_client.mfsl_context,
00895                                        &pmydata->thread_fsal_context  ) ) )
00896     {
00897       /* Failed init */
00898       DisplayLog( "NFS  WORKER #%d: Error initing MFSL", index ) ;
00899       exit( 1 ) ;
00900     }
00901       
00902 #endif 
00903 
00904   /* Init the Cache content client for this worker */
00905   if( cache_content_client_init( &pmydata->cache_content_client,
00906                                  nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param ) )
00907     {
00908       /* Failed init */
00909       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Content client could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00910       exit( 1 ) ;
00911     }
00912   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Content client successfully initialized", index ) ;
00913 
00914   /* The worker thread is not garbagging anything at the time it starts */
00915   pmydata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ;
00916   
00917   /* Bind the data cache client to the inode cache client */
00918   pmydata->cache_inode_client.pcontent_client = (caddr_t)&pmydata->cache_content_client ;
00919   
00920   /* notify dispatcher it is ready */
00921   pmydata->is_ready = TRUE;  
00922  
00923   /* Worker's infinite loop */
00924   while( 1 )
00925     {
00926       
00927       /* update memory and FSAL stats,
00928        * twice often than stats display.
00929        */
00930       if ( time(NULL) - pmydata->stats.last_stat_update > 
00931            (int)nfs_param.core_param.stats_update_delay / 2 )
00932       {
00933         
00934         FSAL_get_stats( &pmydata->stats.fsal_stats, FALSE );
00935         
00936 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00937         BuddyGetStats( &pmydata->stats.buddy_stats ) ;
00938 #endif
00939         /* reset last stat */
00940         pmydata->stats.last_stat_update = time( NULL );
00941       }
00942       
00943       /* Wait on condition variable for work to be done */
00944 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00945       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: waiting for requests to process, nb_entry=%d, nb_invalid=%d", 
00946                        index, pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry, pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid  ) ;   
00947 #endif
00948       P( pmydata->mutex_req_condvar ) ;
00949       while( pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry == pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid )
00950         pthread_cond_wait( &(pmydata->req_condvar), &(pmydata->mutex_req_condvar) ) ;
00951 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00952       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: Processing a new request", index ) ;
00953 #endif
00954       V( pmydata->mutex_req_condvar ) ;
00955 
00956       found = FALSE ;
00957       P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
00958       for( pentry = pmydata->pending_request->LRU ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentry->next )
00959         {
00960           if( pentry->valid_state == LRU_ENTRY_VALID )
00961             {
00962               found = TRUE ;
00963               break ;
00964             }
00965         }
00966       V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
00967 
00968       if( !found )
00969         {
00970           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "NFS WORKER #%d : No pending request available", index ) ;
00971           continue ; /* return to main loop */
00972         }
00973      
00974       pnfsreq = (nfs_request_data_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata ) ;
00975 
00976 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00977       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : I have some work to do, length=%d, invalid=%d",
00978                        index, 
00979                        pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry,
00980                        pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid ) ;
00981 #endif
00982      
00983 #if defined(_USE_TIRPC) || defined( _FREEBSD )
00984       if( pnfsreq->xprt->xp_fd == 0 )
00985         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d:No RPC management, xp_fd==0", index ) ;
00986 #else 
00987       if( pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock == 0 )
00988         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d:No RPC management, xp_sock==0", index ) ;
00989 #endif
00990       else
00991         { 
00992           /* Set pointers */
00993           cred_area = pnfsreq->cred_area;
00994           pmsg = &(pnfsreq->msg) ;
00995           preq = &(pnfsreq->req );
00996           xprt = pnfsreq->xprt ;
00997    
00998 
00999           /*do */
01000             {
01001               if( pnfsreq->status )
01002                 {
01003                   preq->rq_xprt = pnfsreq->xprt ;
01004                   preq->rq_prog = pmsg->rm_call.cb_prog;
01005                   preq->rq_vers = pmsg->rm_call.cb_vers;
01006                   preq->rq_proc = pmsg->rm_call.cb_proc;
01007 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                  
01008                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Prog = %d, vers = %d, proc = %d xprt=%p",
01009                                    pmsg->rm_call.cb_prog, pmsg->rm_call.cb_vers, pmsg->rm_call.cb_proc, preq->rq_xprt ) ;
01010 #endif
01011                   /* Restore previously save GssData */
01012 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
01013                   no_dispatch = FALSE ;
01014                   if( ( why = Rpcsecgss__authenticate( preq, pmsg, &no_dispatch) ) != AUTH_OK )
01015 #else
01016                   if( ( why = _authenticate( preq, pmsg) ) != AUTH_OK)
01017 #endif
01018                     {
01019                         auth_stat2str( why, auth_str ) ;
01020                         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Could not authenticate request... rejecting with AUTH_STAT=%s", auth_str ) ;
01021                         svcerr_auth( xprt, why);
01022                     }
01023                   else
01024                     {
01025 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
01026                       if( preq->rq_xprt->xp_verf.oa_flavor == RPCSEC_GSS )
01027                         {
01028                           gc = (struct rpc_gss_cred *)preq->rq_clntcred;
01029 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01030                           printf( "========> no_dispatch=%u gc->gc_proc=%u RPCSEC_GSS_INIT=%u RPCSEC_GSS_CONTINUE_INIT=%u RPCSEC_GSS_DATA=%u RPCSEC_GSS_DESTROY=%u\n",
01031                                    no_dispatch, gc->gc_proc, RPCSEC_GSS_INIT, RPCSEC_GSS_CONTINUE_INIT, RPCSEC_GSS_DATA, RPCSEC_GSS_DESTROY ) ;
01032 #endif /* _DEBUG_DISPATCH */
01033                         }
01034 #endif                      
01035                       /* A few words of explanation are required here:
01036                        * In authentication is AUTH_NONE or AUTH_UNIX, then the value of no_dispatch remains FALSE and the request is proceeded normally
01037                        * If authentication is RPCSEC_GSS, no_dispatch may have value TRUE, this means that gc->gc_proc != RPCSEC_GSS_DATA and that the 
01038                        * message is in fact an internal negociation message from RPCSEC_GSS using GSSAPI. It then should not be proceed by the worker and
01039                        * SCV_STAT should be returned to the dispatcher */
01040                       if( no_dispatch == FALSE )
01041                         {
01042                           if( preq->rq_prog != nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
01043                             {
01044                               if( preq->rq_prog != nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
01045                                 {
01046                                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid Program number #%d",  preq->rq_prog ) ;
01047                                   svcerr_noprog( xprt ); /* This is no NFS or MOUNT program, exit... */
01048                                 }
01049                               else
01050                                 {
01051                                   /* Call is with MOUNTPROG */
01052                                   if( ( preq->rq_vers != MOUNT_V1) &&
01053                                       ( preq->rq_vers != MOUNT_V3) )
01054                                     {
01055                                       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid Mount Version #%d", preq->rq_vers ) ;
01056                                       svcerr_progvers( xprt, MOUNT_V1, MOUNT_V3 ) ; /* Bad MOUNT version */
01057                                     }
01058                                   else
01059                                     {
01060                                       /* Actual work starts here */
01061                                       nfs_rpc_execute( pnfsreq, pmydata ) ;
01062                                     }
01063                                 }
01064                             }
01065                           else 
01066                             {
01067                               /* If we go there, preq->rq_prog ==  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program */ 
01068 /* FSAL_PROXY supports only NFSv4 except if handle mapping is enabled */
01069 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
01070                               if( ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V2) &&
01071                                   ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V3) &&
01072                                   ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V4) )
01073 #else
01074                               if( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V4 )
01075 #endif
01076                                 {
01077                                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid NFS Version #%d", preq->rq_vers ) ;
01078 #if ! defined( _USE_PROXY ) || defined( _HANDLE_MAPPING )
01079                                   svcerr_progvers( xprt, NFS_V2, NFS_V4 ); /* Bad NFS version */
01080 #else
01081                                   svcerr_progvers( xprt, NFS_V4, NFS_V4 ); /* Bad NFS version */
01082 #endif
01083                                 }
01084                               else 
01085                                 {
01086                                   /* Actual work starts here */
01087                                   nfs_rpc_execute( pnfsreq, pmydata ) ;
01088                                 }
01089                             } /* else from if( preq->rq_prog !=  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program ) */ 
01090                          } /* if( no_dispatch == FALSE ) */
01091                     } /* else from if( ( why = _authenticate( preq, pmsg) ) != AUTH_OK) */
01092                 } /* if( pnfsreq->status ) */
01093             } /* while (  pnfsreq->status == XPRT_MOREREQS ); Now handle at the dispatcher's level */
01094 
01095         }
01096      
01097       /* Free the req by releasing the entry */
01098 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01099       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Invalidating processed entry with xprt_stat=%d", 
01100                        pnfsreq->status ) ;
01101 #endif
01102       P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01103       if( LRU_invalidate( pmydata->pending_request, pentry ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01104         {
01105           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCH: Incoherency: released entry for dispatch could not be tagged invalid") ;
01106         }
01107      V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01108 
01109       
01110       if( pmydata->passcounter > nfs_param.worker_param.nb_before_gc )
01111         {
01112           /* Garbagge collection on dup req cache */
01113 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01114           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: before dupreq invalidation nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01115                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01116 #endif
01117           if( (rc = LRU_invalidate_by_function( pmydata->duplicate_request, nfs_dupreq_gc_function, NULL )) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01118             {
01119               DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: FAILURE: Impossible to invalidate entries for duplicate request cache (error %d)",
01120                           index, rc ) ;
01121             }
01122 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01123           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: after dupreq invalidation nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01124                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01125 #endif
01126           if( (rc = LRU_gc_invalid( pmydata->duplicate_request, (void *)&pmydata->dupreq_pool)) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01127             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS WORKER #%d: FAILURE: Impossible to gc entries for duplicate request cache (error %d)", 
01128                              index, rc ) ;
01129           else
01130             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: gc entries for duplicate request cache OK", index ) ;
01131 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01132           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: after dupreq gc nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01133                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01134 
01135           /* Performing garbabbge collection */
01136           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collecting on pending request list", index ) ;
01137 #endif
01138           pmydata->passcounter = 0 ;
01139           P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01140 
01141           if( LRU_gc_invalid( pmydata->pending_request, (void *)&pmydata->request_pool ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01142             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, 
01143                              "NFS WORKER #%d: ERROR: Impossible garbagge collection on pending request list",
01144                              index ) ;
01145           else
01146             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collection on pending request list OK", index ) ;
01147           
01148           V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01149 
01150         }
01151 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01152       else
01153         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collection isn't necessary count=%d, max=%d", 
01154                          index, pmydata->passcounter, nfs_param.worker_param.nb_before_gc ) ;
01155 #endif
01156       pmydata->passcounter += 1 ;
01157 
01158       /* In case of the use of TCP, commit the dispatcher */
01159       if( pnfsreq->ipproto == IPPROTO_TCP )
01160        {
01161 #if defined( _USE_TIRPC ) || defined( _FREEBSD ) 
01162          P( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_fd] ) ;
01163          etat_xprt[xprt->xp_fd] = 1 ;
01164          pthread_cond_signal( &(condvar_xprt[xprt->xp_fd]) ) ;
01165          V( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_fd] ) ;
01166 #else
01167          //printf( "worker : P pour sur %u\n", pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock ) ; 
01168          P( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] ) ;
01169          etat_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] = 1 ;
01170          pthread_cond_signal( &(condvar_xprt[xprt->xp_sock]) ) ;
01171          V( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] ) ;
01172 #endif
01173        }
01174  
01175 
01176       /* If needed, perform garbagge collection on cache_inode layer */
01177       P( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01178       if( nb_current_gc_workers < nfs_param.core_param.nb_max_concurrent_gc )
01179         {
01180           nb_current_gc_workers += 1 ; 
01181           gc_allowed = TRUE ;
01182         }
01183       else
01184         gc_allowed = FALSE ;
01185       V( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01186 
01187       if( gc_allowed == TRUE )
01188         {
01189           pmydata->gc_in_progress = TRUE ;
01190 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01191           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "There are %d concurrent garbagge collection", nb_current_gc_workers ) ;
01192 #endif
01193 
01194           if( cache_inode_gc( pmydata->ht, 
01195                               &(pmydata->cache_inode_client), 
01196                               &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
01197             {
01198               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad cache_inode garbagge collection" ) ;
01199             }
01200          
01201  
01202           P( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01203           nb_current_gc_workers -= 1 ;
01204           V( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01205 
01206           pmydata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ; 
01207         }
01208 
01209 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01210   /* As MFSL context are refresh, and because this could be a time consuming operation, the worker is 
01211    * set as "making garbagge collection" to avoid new requests to come in its pending queue */
01212   pmydata->gc_in_progress = TRUE ;
01213 
01214   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( MFSL_RefreshContext( &pmydata->cache_inode_client.mfsl_context,
01215                                           &pmydata->thread_fsal_context  ) ) )
01216     {
01217       /* Failed init */
01218       DisplayLog( "NFS  WORKER #%d: Error regreshing MFSL context", index ) ;
01219       exit( 1 ) ;
01220     }
01221 
01222   pmydata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ;
01223 
01224 #endif
01225 
01226 
01227     } /* while( 1 ) */
01228   return NULL ;
01229 } /* worker_thread */
01230
